A player performing the dragon dagger's special attack, Puncture.

The dragon dagger is the second-strongest dagger available in Old School RuneScape, behind the abyssal dagger. It can be wielded by players with at least 60 Attack after completion of the Lost City quest.

If casting either of the alchemy spells on a dragon dagger, use a cleaning cloth on poisoned versions to make more profit, as the value of the unpoisoned dagger is higher than any of the poisoned versions, 18,000 compared to 14,400.

As with most dragon equipment, the dragon dagger cannot be made from raw materials using the Smithing skill.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

The dragon dagger's special attack, Puncture, deals two hits at once with an extra 15% accuracy and 15% damage for each of the two hits, consuming 25% of the wielder's special attack energy. Puncture rolls against opponent's slash defence roll.

When used against other players, both hits are applied simultaneously. There is a slight delay between the two hits when the special is used on NPCs.

The special attack's highest possible hit under normal combat conditions is 48 damage for each of the two hits, or a total of 96 damage. Although rare, the poisoned dagger's special attack can occasionally stack with the poison damage, resulting in a theoretical damage stack of 102. Against a slayer target with a Black mask or Slayer helm equipped, the maximum becomes 52 per hit, dealing a maximum of 104 damage.

For these reasons, the dragon dagger is a staple 'knock-out' weapon in PvP combat, and a cheap option for a high damage spec weapon in PvM. Dragon claws are often superior, but carry a much higher price.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
7 July 2021
(update)

The position of the weapon and its variants on female players has been adjusted so that they appear to be equipped properly.

6 February 2020
(update)

The tooltip for the dragon dagger's special attack now correctly states its accuracy buff as 15%.

13 October 2016
(update)

The Dragon Dagger special attack no longer hits twice at the same time in PvM scenarios.

29 January 2015
(update)

The super strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Drag dagger(p++)" to "Dragon dagger(p++)".

22 August 2006
(update)
  • The extra strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Dragon dagger(+)" to "Dragon dagger(p+)".
  • The super strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Dragon dagger(s)" to "Drag dagger(p++)".
29 March 2004
(update)

The item became permanently available with the launch of RuneScape 2.

25 February 2004
(update)

The item was added to the RuneScape 2 Beta.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

The stranger uses the dragon dagger's special attack, Puncture.
  • The stranger that may be encountered during Desert Treasure uses a poisoned dragon dagger, and is capable of using the special attack in rapid succession. Saradomin wizards and melee-using Ancient wizards also use a poisoned dragon dagger.
  • If the dragon dagger's special attack deals more damage than required to kill the opponent, it will provide experience for the surplus damage, like other weapons with a multi-hit special attack, such as dragon claws.
  • The dragon dagger is one of only three daggers with its blade pointing down; the other two are the keris and the abyssal dagger.
  • Prior to 22 August 2006, weapon poison(+) and weapon poison(++) variants of the dragon dagger were named dragon dagger(+), which was for extra strong weapon poison, and dragon dagger(s), which was for super weapon poison — hence the nickname, "DDS". This was later changed to the current (p+) and (p++) naming convention to avoid confusion with Saradomin items, which also use (s).[1]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. "Naming conventions". 22 August 2006. (Archived from the original.) Old School RuneScape News.

[[File:Puncture.gif|frame|A player performing the dragon dagger's special attack, ''Puncture''.]]
The '''dragon dagger''' is the second-strongest [[dagger]] available in ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'', behind the [[abyssal dagger]]. It can be wielded by players with at least 60 [[Attack]] after completion of the [[Lost City]] quest.

If casting either of the [[alchemy spells]] on a dragon dagger, use a [[cleaning cloth]] on poisoned versions to make more profit, as the [[value]] of the unpoisoned dagger is higher than any of the poisoned versions, {{NoCoins|18,000}} compared to {{NoCoins|14,400}}.

As with most [[dragon equipment]], the dragon dagger '''cannot''' be made from raw materials using the [[Smithing]] skill.

==Special attack==
The dragon dagger's special attack, ''Puncture'', deals two hits at once with an extra 15% accuracy and 15% damage for each of the two hits, consuming 25% of the wielder's special attack energy. ''Puncture'' rolls against opponent's slash defence roll.

When used against other players, both hits are applied simultaneously. There is a slight delay between the two hits when the special is used on NPCs.

The special attack's highest possible hit under normal combat conditions is 48 damage for each of the two hits, or a total of '''96''' damage. Although rare, the poisoned dagger's special attack can occasionally stack with the [[Weapon poison(++)|poison]] damage, resulting in a theoretical damage stack of 102. Against a slayer target with a [[Black mask]] or [[Slayer helm]] equipped, the maximum becomes 52 per hit, dealing a maximum of '''104''' damage.

For these reasons, the dragon dagger is a staple 'knock-out' weapon in [[PvP]] combat, and a cheap option for a high damage spec weapon in [[PvM]]. [[Dragon claws]] are often superior, but carry a much higher price.

==Trivia==
[[File:Stranger.gif|220px|thumb|The [[stranger]] uses the dragon dagger's special attack, ''Puncture''.]]
*The [[stranger]] that may be encountered during [[Desert Treasure]] uses a poisoned dragon dagger, and is capable of using the special attack in rapid succession. [[Saradomin wizard]]s and melee-using [[Ancient Wizard|Ancient wizards]] also use a poisoned dragon dagger.
*If the dragon dagger's special attack deals more damage than required to kill the opponent, it will provide experience for the surplus damage, like other weapons with a multi-hit special attack, such as [[dragon claws]].
*The dragon dagger is one of only three daggers with its blade pointing down; the other two are the [[keris]] and the [[abyssal dagger]].
*Prior to [[22 August]] [[2006]], [[weapon poison(+)]] and [[weapon poison(++)]] variants of the dragon dagger were named dragon dagger(+), which was for extra strong weapon poison, and dragon dagger(s), which was for super weapon poison — hence the nickname, "DDS". This was later changed to the current (p+) and (p++) naming convention to avoid confusion with Saradomin items, which also use (s).{{CiteNews |url=https://secure.runescape.com/m=news/naming-conventions |title=Naming conventions |newsdate=22 August 2006}}
